NPS photo  Weather at Tuzigoot National Monument can vary greatly with the time of year. Summer days in central Arizona can be extremely hot. Temperatures range from 95°F (35°C) up to and exceeding 110°F (42°C). Nighttime temperatures can be much cooler, around 70°F (21°C). From late June through early August, heavy rains called monsoons are common in the afternoons. Winter highs at the monument average around 55°F (13°C) but may be significantly colder. Lows at night may be in the teens (-10°C). Snow is rare at Tuzigoot National Monument but does occasionally occur. Always make sure to drink plenty of water while visiting. Park rangers recommend sunscreen in all weather conditions at all times of year.
